quoteFirst: A Christian Legislative Assembly, like that of Canada, of which Sir James Craig afterwards privately expressed an opinion so ludicrously high, could not be contaminated with the presence of a Jew. By a vote of
quoteLast: , it was resolved:--"That Ezekiel Hart, Esquire, professing the Jewish religion, cannot take a seat, nor sit, nor vote in this House." Ezekiel departed. The word "_baruch_," was on his tongue, the signification of which, like that of the French word "_sacr√©_," may signify, according to the humour of the utterer, either an anathema or a blessing.
title: The Rise of Canada, from Barbarism to Wealth and Civilisation. Volume 1
author: Roger, Charles, 1819-

title: Nick Carter Stories No. 137, April 24, 1915: The Seal of Gijon; Or, Nick Carter's Ice-House Fight
author: Carter, Nicholas (House name); Phillips, Roland Ashford
